security_audit.summary: This is a pure documentation/prompt-based skill containing only markdown files with workflow guides, interview templates, and best practices. No executable code, scripts, network calls, or file system modifications are present. The skill serves as a coordination layer that references other skills for actual execution.

content.user_title: Orchestrate WordPress projects from setup to launch
content.value_statement: Managing WordPress projects requires coordinating multiple skills and workflows. This orchestrator guides you through discovery interviews, site setup, comprehensive audits, and client handoff. It coordinates SEO, visual QA, performance, and security checks into a unified workflow.
actual_capabilities: Run discovery interviews to gather project requirements and brand guidelines
Generate comprehensive todo lists for WordPress project phases
Coordinate parallel audits across SEO, visual, performance, and security skills
Create Docker environments with WordPress, plugins, and theme scaffolding
Package themes for distribution with demo content export
Generate client handoff documentation and training materials
limitations: Does not execute code directly - orchestrates other skills for actions
Requires other WordPress skills installed for full functionality
Cannot modify production sites without explicit user approval
Documentation-based; actual WordPress operations handled by coordinated skills

use_cases.title: New site setup
use_cases.description: Start new WordPress projects with structured discovery, Docker environment, and theme scaffolding.

use_cases.title: Site audits
use_cases.description: Run comprehensive audits across SEO, performance, visual QA, and security for client sites.

use_cases.title: Client handoff
use_cases.description: Prepare white-labeled admin areas and documentation for client site delivery.

prompt_templates.title: New project
prompt_templates.prompt: I want to set up a new WordPress site for a client. Use /wp-setup to run the discovery interview, then create a Docker environment and generate a todo list for the project.

prompt_templates.title: Site audit
prompt_templates.prompt: Audit this WordPress site at [URL]. Run /wp-audit to check SEO, performance, visual QA, and security. Generate an action plan with prioritized fixes.

prompt_templates.title: Performance boost
prompt_templates.prompt: Optimize performance for this WordPress site. Check Core Web Vitals, configure caching, and optimize images. Target PageSpeed score of 80+.

prompt_templates.title: Pre-launch
prompt_templates.prompt: Prepare this WordPress site for launch. Run /wp-launch checklist, verify all pages have content, test forms, and generate client handoff documentation.

output_examples.input: Set up a new WordPress project for a real estate company
output: ✓ Discovery interview started - gathering business profile, brand assets, and site requirements
✓ Docker environment created with WordPress, MySQL, and phpMyAdmin
✓ Theme scaffold generated with required directories and files
✓ Plugin recommendations compiled: ASE, Branda, Yoast SEO, LiteSpeed Cache
✓ Todo list generated: Foundation → Content → SEO → Performance → Launch

best_practices: Always run discovery interviews before starting new WordPress projects to capture client requirements
Use parallel agents for multi-page audits to speed up comprehensive site reviews
Generate todo lists in phases to make complex projects manageable and trackable
anti_patterns: Skipping discovery phase and assuming project requirements without client input
Making changes to production sites without testing in staging first
Neglecting to export demo content before packaging themes for distribution

faq.question: What other skills does wp-orchestrator coordinate?
faq.answer: It coordinates wordpress-dev, wordpress-admin, seo-optimizer, visual-qa, brand-guide, white-label, gsap-animations, wp-performance, wp-docker, and wp-playground skills.

faq.question: What are the system requirements for WordPress projects?
faq.answer: Requires Python 3.8+, Node.js 18+, Docker and Docker Compose, Git, and optional GitHub CLI. Python packages: playwright, requests, beautifulsoup4.

faq.question: Can this skill modify my production WordPress site?
faq.answer: No. The orchestrator coordinates other skills but requires explicit user approval for any production modifications. All changes should be tested in staging first.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. This is a documentation-based skill with no network calls or file modifications. It generates guidance and coordinates other skills that run locally.

faq.question: Why are audit results different from expected?
faq.answer: Ensure the site URL is accessible, required Python packages are installed, and Docker containers are running. Check that ports are not blocked by firewalls.

faq.question: How does wp-orchestrator compare to manual WordPress setup?
faq.answer: It provides standardized workflows, automated parallel audits, and comprehensive checklists. Reduces manual coordination and ensures nothing is missed during complex projects.
